alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Houston; Macon; Peach; Schley; Taylor (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Macon, Peach, central Houston, south central Crawford, north central Schley and southeastern Taylor Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 653 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Byron to near Tazewell, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Perry, Fort Valley, Warner Robins, Marshallville, Reynolds, Ideal, Saint Louis, Whitewater State Park, Nakomis, Rupert, Garden Valley, Hicks, Potterville, Lakewood, Powerville, Lee Pope, Winchester and Miami Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and west central Georgia.
